This website was created by Javed Ali, a Graduate Research Assistant at the University of Central Florida, and methodology was developed and implemented in collaboration with [Dr. Thomas Wahl](https://core-lab.weebly.com/) (Supervisor), [Dr. Alejandra Enriquez](https://www.linkedin.com/in/alejandra-rodr%C3%ADguez-enr%C3%ADquez-426b3263/) (Co-Supervisor), and [Dr. Md. Mamunur Rashid](https://mmrashid.weebly.com/) (Co-Supervisor). Javed has been involved in a National Academy of Sciences funded project “[The New First Line of Defense: Building Community Resilience through Residential Risk Disclosure](https://hazardaware.org/)”. This website is a part of the project's deliverable.

Javed is a Water Resources Engineer and Graduate Research Assistant in the [Coastal Risks and Engineering Lab](https://core-lab.weebly.com/) at University of Central Florida (UCF). His work involves multi-hazards risk assessment and analyzing compound climate/weather extreme events and their spatio-temporal interactions and socio-economic impacts using machine learning and statistical methods.
